content:
That bodes ill for climate change

MATHEMATICAL MODELS of climate change predict that the severity of natural disasters will increase as the world warms. The cyclone that hit Mozambique on March 14th, killing perhaps 1,000 people, has further focused attention on the risks posed by rising temperatures. Even so, the man-made carbon emissions that drive global warming continue to grow. According to a new report from the International Energy Agency (IEA), a think-tank based in Paris, energy-related CO2 emissions rose by 1.7% last year, to 33.1 gigatonnes. The increase, of 560 metric tonnes compared with 2017, was equivalent to a full year’s worth of emissions from international aviation.

Carbon emissions have been driven higher by increasing demand for all types of energy. Broadly speaking, changes in energy demand track the fortunes of the world economy. Robust global GDP growth of 3.7% last year caused energy demand to rise by some 2.3%, its fastest pace for a decade. And although energy efficiency did improve and use of renewable sources did increase—solar power generation rose by 31%—these gains were dwarfed by the growth in the use of fossil fuels, which accounted for 70% of the rise in global energy consumption.

Burning of coal, the most egregious source of carbon, accounted for a third of the growth in emissions. A new generation of coal-fired power plants in Asia was responsible for nearly all the additional global demand. Those power plants are expected to remain active for another 40 years. Much more encouragingly, and despite President Donald Trump’s advocacy for America’s coal industry, America’s abundant supply of natural gas has led firms rapidly to switch from coal to gas power. Natural-gas consumption in the United States increased by 10% last year, equivalent to Britain’s total annual consumption.

Perhaps the most worrying finding in the report is the threat of a feedback loop between severe weather events and carbon emissions. According to the IEA, a hotter-than-average summer and colder-than-average winter led to greater use of heating and air conditioning, which together were responsible for about half of the rise in energy demand in America and roughly a fifth of the worldwide increase. If humans keep burning fuel to shield themselves from extreme temperatures, and the emissions produced by that activity cause temperatures to become ever more extreme, the worst-case scenarios for climate change are more likely to materialise.

ex: adj. 更冷的，越来越冷的（cold的比较级）

He was advised to reduce his alcohol consumption.

她对党员发表的讲话并不打算公诸大众。

现代社会的主要特征是消费而不是储蓄。

ex: adj. 惊人的；过分的；恶名昭彰的
eg2: The banker noted that it was the brazenness of the letter ... that was particularly .

One is simple accuracy; in this example, the misspelled name and wrong employer were .
第一个是单纯的准确；在这个例子中，拼错名字和搞错雇主都是很过分的。
If there’s an egregious word in a sentence, you know there’s something going on.
如果一句话了里面有一个异乎寻常的词， 读者就知道他是在试图表达什么。

ex: adv. 鼓励地；勉励人地
eg2: The father smiled and looked at his son , “Dear son, you have thought it to be very complex and stunned yourself.
父亲微笑着，用鼓励的眼神看着儿子：“儿子，你把这条路想得太复杂了，你被自己吓坏了。
Perhaps more , the study found that nearly three-quarters of youths aged 15-29 have used the internet, and almost half of them have read books on the web.
也许较为鼓舞人心的是，该研究发现年龄在15到29岁之间的青年中，有近四分之三使用因特网，几乎一半的人在网上读书。

ex: adj. 热的；热烈的
eg2: The coldest growing seasons of the future will be hotter than the hottest in the past.
未来最冷的生长季节将比过去最热的生长季节还来得热。
So, while it is indeed much hotter than it used to be, we may be witnessing a new normal in heat and other extreme weather.
所以，尽管这天气确实比过去热了好多，但这也许正是一种新的“正常”高温，伴随着其他极端天气状况。
To the layperson, the notion is persuasive because it is intuitive — malaria is rife where the world is hot, so if the world gets hotter there will be more of it.
对于普通人，这一观念具有说服力，因为它是直观的——疟疾在炎热的地区流行，因此如果世界变得更炎热，就会有更多的疟疾。

ex: adj. 公制的；米制的；公尺的
n. 度量标准
eg2: If you have not used a metric lately, why are you still collecting it?
如果您最近不使用某个度量标准，那么为什么您仍旧收集它呢？
For every , you should specify what action you should take based on certain threshold values.
对于每个度量标准，您应该指定根据某个阀值应该采取什么行动。
Whatever your metric of success, you can go back and see just how far you’ve come.
无论你衡量成功的标准是什么，你都可以回顾过去，并看到你已经走了那么远。

wp.renewable resource: 可再生资源;不可再生资源;可再生能源;		可更新资源

ex: adj. 可再生的；可更新的；可继续的
n. 再生性能源
eg2: On the tiny blue planet we see from space, the light side of the force is clean, green and .
从宇宙中看，在这个小小的蓝色星球上，原力明亮的一面是洁净的、绿色的、可再生的。
Do any of you believe we can reduce the dependence on foreign oil without investing in alternative sources of energy,  energy?
你们有人相信我们可以不投资其他替代的能源、可再生能源而能减少对境外石油的依赖吗？
We have massive renewable energy potential but we use only a fraction of it.
我们有大量可用的可再生资源，但智能利用其中的一部分。

ex: n. 方案；情节；剧本；设想
eg2: In this , a user retrieves data from the database with no locks.
在此方案中，用户从数据库中检索数据而不加任何锁。
I guess you wrote about this senior from , but it sounds like he presented, right?
我觉得你是从那个剧本里写出的这篇文章,但听起来像是他提出的，是么？
But we may not be able to do this for every .
但是我们不能每一种场景下都这么做。

wp.Alarm Severity: 告警等级;警报严重性输血;报警严重性基站;警报严重输血服务中心
wp.Accident Severity: 事故严重程度;事故严重度;事故严重性;事故严峻水平

ex: n. 严重；严格；猛烈
eg2: What is the defect count, and what is the  of those defects?
缺陷数是多少，并且这些缺陷的严重级别是什么？
Otherwise, you might ask the application to provide some measure of the expected frequency and severity of failures.
否则，您可能会要求应用程序提供一些预计频率和失效的严重程度的方法。
But what is less often remarked on is that the plants themselves affect the nature and severity of fire.
但人们不那么注意的是，正是这些植物自身影响了自然和火灾的猛烈程度。

ex: n. 屏障；挡板；盾（牌）；保护人
v. 保护某人或某物（免遭危险、伤害或不快）；给…加防护罩
网络 盾牌；屏蔽；护盾
eg2: The gunman used the hostages as a human shield .
持枪歹徒用人质作人体盾牌。
Water is not an effective shield against the sun's more harmful rays.
水不能有效阻挡太阳中更有害的射线。
She hid her true feelings behind a shield of cold indifference.
她把自己的真实感情掩藏在一副冷漠的外表后面。
I shielded my eyes against the glare.
我挡住眼睛以避开强光。
The ozone layer shields the earth from the sun's ultraviolet rays.
臭氧层保护地球不受太阳紫外线的辐射。
You can't shield her from the truth forever.
你不可能永远瞒着她，不让她知道事实真相。
Police believe that somebody is shielding the killer.
警方认为有人把杀人凶手窝藏了起来。

ex: n. 吨（等于 1 000 公斤）
网络 公吨；可实现在线吨；公顿
eg2: a record grain harvest of 236m tonnes
创纪录的 2.36 亿公吨谷物收获量
a 17-tonne truck
17 吨卡车

Title: Energy consumption increased at a record rate in 2018

paperStatistics.title: Energy consumption increased at a record rate in 2018
paperStatistics.desc: That bodes ill for climate change
